BatchCreateChannelMembership.name: BatchCreateChannelMembership
BatchCreateChannelMembership.documentation: Adds a specified number of users to a channel.

CreateChannel.name: CreateChannel
CreateChannel.documentation:
Creates a channel to which you can add users and send messages.

Restriction: You can't change a channel's privacy.

The x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header.

CreateChannelBan.name: CreateChannelBan
CreateChannelBan.documentation:
Permanently bans a member from a channel. Moderators can't add banned members to a channel. To undo a ban, you first have to DeleteChannelBan, and then CreateChannelMembership. Bans are cleaned up when you delete users or channels.

If you ban a user who is already part of a channel, that user is automatically kicked from the channel.

The x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header.

CreateChannelMembership.name: CreateChannelMembership
CreateChannelMembership.documentation:
Adds a user to a channel. The InvitedBy response field is derived from the request header. A channel member can:

  • List messages

  • Send messages

  • Receive messages

  • Edit their own messages

  • Leave the channel

Privacy settings impact this action as follows:

  • Public Channels: You do not need to be a member to list messages, but you must be a member to send messages.

  • Private Channels: You must be a member to list or send messages.

The x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header.

CreateChannelModerator.name: CreateChannelModerator
CreateChannelModerator.documentation:
Creates a new ChannelModerator. A channel moderator can:

  • Add and remove other members of the channel.

  • Add and remove other moderators of the channel.

  • Add and remove user bans for the channel.

  • Redact messages in the channel.

  • List messages in the channel.

The x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header.

DeleteChannel.name: DeleteChannel
DeleteChannel.documentation:
Immediately makes a channel and its memberships inaccessible and marks them for deletion. This is an irreversible process.

The x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header.

DeleteChannelBan.name: DeleteChannelBan
DeleteChannelBan.documentation:
Removes a user from a channel's ban list.

The x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header.

DeleteChannelMembership.name: DeleteChannelMembership
DeleteChannelMembership.documentation:
Removes a member from a channel.

The x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header.

DeleteChannelMessage.name: DeleteChannelMessage
DeleteChannelMessage.documentation:
Deletes a channel message. Only admins can perform this action. Deletion makes messages inaccessible immediately. A background process deletes any revisions created by UpdateChannelMessage.

The x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header.

DeleteChannelModerator.name: DeleteChannelModerator
DeleteChannelModerator.documentation:
Deletes a channel moderator.

The x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header.

DescribeChannel.name: DescribeChannel
DescribeChannel.documentation:
Returns the full details of a channel in an Amazon Chime AppInstance.

The x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header.

DescribeChannelBan.name: DescribeChannelBan
DescribeChannelBan.documentation:
Returns the full details of a channel ban.

The x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header.

DescribeChannelMembership.name: DescribeChannelMembership
DescribeChannelMembership.documentation:
Returns the full details of a user's channel membership.

The x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header.

DescribeChannelMembershipForAppInstanceU.name: DescribeChannelMembershipForAppInstanceUser
DescribeChannelMembershipForAppInstanceU.documentation:
Returns the details of a channel based on the membership of the specified AppInstanceUser.

The x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header.

DescribeChannelModeratedByAppInstanceUse.name: DescribeChannelModeratedByAppInstanceUser
DescribeChannelModeratedByAppInstanceUse.documentation:
Returns the full details of a channel moderated by the specified AppInstanceUser.

The x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header.

DescribeChannelModerator.name: DescribeChannelModerator
DescribeChannelModerator.documentation:
Returns the full details of a single ChannelModerator.

The x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header.

GetChannelMessage.name: GetChannelMessage
GetChannelMessage.documentation:
Gets the full details of a channel message.

The x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header.

GetMessagingSessionEndpoint.name: GetMessagingSessionEndpoint
GetMessagingSessionEndpoint.documentation: The details of the endpoint for the messaging session.

ListChannelBans.name: ListChannelBans
ListChannelBans.documentation:
Lists all the users banned from a particular channel.

The x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header.

ListChannelMemberships.name: ListChannelMemberships
ListChannelMemberships.documentation:
Lists all channel memberships in a channel.

The x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header.

ListChannelMembershipsForAppInstanceUser.name: ListChannelMembershipsForAppInstanceUser
ListChannelMembershipsForAppInstanceUser.documentation:
Lists all channels that a particular AppInstanceUser is a part of. Only an AppInstanceAdmin can call the API with a user ARN that is not their own.

The x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header.

ListChannelMessages.name: ListChannelMessages
ListChannelMessages.documentation:
List all the messages in a channel. Returns a paginated list of ChannelMessages. By default, sorted by creation timestamp in descending order.

Redacted messages appear in the results as empty, since they are only redacted, not deleted. Deleted messages do not appear in the results. This action always returns the latest version of an edited message.

Also, the x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header.

ListChannelModerators.name: ListChannelModerators
ListChannelModerators.documentation:
Lists all the moderators for a channel.

The x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header.

ListChannels.name: ListChannels
ListChannels.documentation:
Lists all Channels created under a single Chime App as a paginated list. You can specify filters to narrow results.

Functionality & restrictions

  • Use privacy = PUBLIC to retrieve all public channels in the account.

  • Only an AppInstanceAdmin can set privacy = PRIVATE to list the private channels in an account.

The x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header.

ListChannelsModeratedByAppInstanceUser.name: ListChannelsModeratedByAppInstanceUser
ListChannelsModeratedByAppInstanceUser.documentation:
A list of the channels moderated by an AppInstanceUser.

The x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header.

RedactChannelMessage.name: RedactChannelMessage
RedactChannelMessage.documentation:
Redacts message content, but not metadata. The message exists in the back end, but the action returns null content, and the state shows as redacted.

The x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header.

SendChannelMessage.name: SendChannelMessage
SendChannelMessage.documentation:
Sends a message to a particular channel that the member is a part of.

The x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header.

Also, STANDARD messages can contain 4KB of data and the 1KB of metadata. CONTROL messages can contain 30 bytes of data and no metadata.

UpdateChannel.name: UpdateChannel
UpdateChannel.documentation:
Update a channel's attributes.

Restriction: You can't change a channel's privacy.

The x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header.

UpdateChannelMessage.name: UpdateChannelMessage
UpdateChannelMessage.documentation:
Updates the content of a message.

The x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header.

UpdateChannelReadMarker.name: UpdateChannelReadMarker
UpdateChannelReadMarker.documentation:
The details of the time when a user last read messages in a channel.

The x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header.

ReadMarkerTimestamp.documentation: The time at which a message was last read.

AppInstanceUserMembershipSummary.documentation: Summary of the membership details of an AppInstanceUser.

BadRequestException.documentation: The input parameters don't match the service's restrictions.

InvitedBy.documentation: The identifier of the member who invited another member.

Type.documentation: The membership types set for the channel users.

Members.documentation: The users successfully added to the request.

ChannelArn.documentation: The ARN of the channel to which you're adding users.

BatchChannelMemberships.documentation: The membership information, including member ARNs, the channel ARN, and membership types.

MemberArn.documentation: The ARN of the member that the service couldn't add.

BatchCreateChannelMembershipError.documentation: A list of failed member ARNs, error codes, and error messages.

ChannelArn.documentation: The ARN of the channel to which you're adding users.

Type.documentation: The membership type of a user, DEFAULT or HIDDEN. Default members are always returned as part of ListChannelMemberships. Hidden members are only returned if the type filter in ListChannelMemberships equals HIDDEN. Otherwise hidden members are not returned. This is only supported by moderators.

MemberArns.documentation: The ARNs of the members you want to add to the channel.

ChimeBearer.documentation: The AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call.

BatchChannelMemberships.documentation: The list of channel memberships in the response.

Errors.documentation: If the action fails for one or more of the memberships in the request, a list of the memberships is returned, along with error codes and error messages.

CreatedTimestamp.documentation: The time at which the AppInstanceUser created the channel.

LastMessageTimestamp.documentation: The time at which a member sent the last message in the channel.

LastUpdatedTimestamp.documentation: The time at which a channel was last updated.

Member.documentation: The member being banned from the channel.

ChannelArn.documentation: The ARN of the channel from which a member is being banned.

CreatedTimestamp.documentation: The time at which the ban was created.

Member.documentation: The member being banned from a channel.

InvitedBy.documentation: The identifier of the member who invited another member.

Type.documentation: The membership type set for the channel member.

CreatedTimestamp.documentation: The time at which the channel membership was created.

LastUpdatedTimestamp.documentation: The time at which a channel membership was last updated.

AppInstanceUserMembershipSummary.documentation: Returns the channel membership data for an AppInstance.

ChannelMembershipForAppInstanceUserSumma.documentation: Summary of the channel membership details of an AppInstanceUser.

CreatedTimestamp.documentation: The time at which the message was created.

LastEditedTimestamp.documentation: The time at which a message was edited.

LastUpdatedTimestamp.documentation: The time at which a message was updated.

Persistence.documentation: The persistence setting for a channel message.

ChannelMessage.documentation: The details of a message in a channel.

CreatedTimestamp.documentation: The time at which the message summary was created.

LastUpdatedTimestamp.documentation: The time at which a message was last updated.

LastEditedTimestamp.documentation: The time at which a message was last edited.

ChannelModeratedByAppInstanceUserSummary.documentation: Summary of the details of a moderated channel.

CreatedTimestamp.documentation: The time at which the moderator was created.

LastMessageTimestamp.documentation: The time at which the last message in a channel was sent.

ConflictException.documentation: The request could not be processed because of conflict in the current state of the resource.

MemberArn.documentation: The ARN of the member being banned.

ChimeBearer.documentation: The AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call.

ChannelArn.documentation: The ARN of the response to the ban request.

Member.documentation: The ChannelArn and BannedIdentity of the member in the ban response.

ChannelArn.documentation: The ARN of the channel to which you're adding users.

MemberArn.documentation: The ARN of the member you want to add to the channel.

Type.documentation: The membership type of a user, DEFAULT or HIDDEN. Default members are always returned as part of ListChannelMemberships. Hidden members are only returned if the type filter in ListChannelMemberships equals HIDDEN. Otherwise hidden members are not returned. This is only supported by moderators.

ChimeBearer.documentation: The AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call.

Member.documentation: The ARN and metadata of the member being added.

ChimeBearer.documentation: The AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call.

ChannelModerator.documentation: The ARNs of the channel and the moderator.

Mode.documentation: The channel mode: UNRESTRICTED or RESTRICTED. Administrators, moderators, and channel members can add themselves and other members to unrestricted channels. Only administrators and moderators can add members to restricted channels.

Privacy.documentation: The channel's privacy level: PUBLIC or PRIVATE. Private channels aren't discoverable by users outside the channel. Public channels are discoverable by anyone in the AppInstance.

Metadata.documentation: The metadata of the creation request. Limited to 1KB and UTF-8.

ClientRequestToken.documentation: The client token for the request. An Idempotency token.

ChimeBearer.documentation: The AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call.

ChannelArn.documentation: The ARN of the channel from which the AppInstanceUser was banned.

MemberArn.documentation: The ARN of the AppInstanceUser that you want to reinstate.

ChimeBearer.documentation: The AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call.

ChannelArn.documentation: The ARN of the channel from which you want to remove the user.

MemberArn.documentation: The ARN of the member that you're removing from the channel.

ChimeBearer.documentation: The AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call.

MessageId.documentation: The ID of the message being deleted.

ChimeBearer.documentation: The AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call.

ChannelModeratorArn.documentation: The ARN of the moderator being deleted.

ChimeBearer.documentation: The AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call.

ChannelArn.documentation: The ARN of the channel being deleted.

ChimeBearer.documentation: The AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call.

ChannelArn.documentation: The ARN of the channel from which the user is banned.

MemberArn.documentation: The ARN of the member being banned.

ChimeBearer.documentation: The AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call.

ChannelArn.documentation: The ARN of the channel to which the user belongs.

AppInstanceUserArn.documentation: The ARN of the user in a channel.

ChimeBearer.documentation: The AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call.

ChannelMembership.documentation: The channel to which a user belongs.

ChimeBearer.documentation: The AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call.

AppInstanceUserArn.documentation: The ARN of the AppInstanceUser in the moderated channel.

ChimeBearer.documentation: The AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call.
The AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call.
The AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call.

ForbiddenException.documentation: The client is permanently forbidden from making the request.

ChimeBearer.documentation: The AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call.

ChannelMessage.documentation: The details of and content in the message.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of bans that you want returned.

NextToken.documentation: The token passed by previous API calls until all requested bans are returned.

ChimeBearer.documentation: The AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call.

NextToken.documentation: The token passed by previous API calls until all requested bans are returned.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of users that you want returned.

NextToken.documentation: The token returned from previous API requests until the number of channel memberships is reached.

ChimeBearer.documentation: The AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call.

ChannelMemberships.documentation: The token passed by previous API calls until all requested users are returned.

NextToken.documentation: The token passed by previous API calls until all requested users are returned.

ChannelArn.documentation: The maximum number of channel memberships that you want returned.

Type.documentation: The membership type of a user, DEFAULT or HIDDEN. Default members are always returned as part of ListChannelMemberships. Hidden members are only returned if the type filter in ListChannelMemberships equals HIDDEN. Otherwise hidden members are not returned.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of channel memberships that you want returned.

NextToken.documentation: The token passed by previous API calls until all requested channel memberships are returned.

ChimeBearer.documentation: The AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call.

ChannelMemberships.documentation: The information for the requested channel memberships.

NextToken.documentation: The token passed by previous API calls until all requested channel memberships are returned.

SortOrder.documentation: The order in which you want messages sorted. Default is Descending, based on time created.

NotBefore.documentation: The initial or starting time stamp for your requested messages.

NotAfter.documentation: The final or ending time stamp for your requested messages.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of messages that you want returned.

NextToken.documentation: The token passed by previous API calls until all requested messages are returned.

ChimeBearer.documentation: The AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call.

ChannelArn.documentation: The ARN of the channel containing the requested messages.

NextToken.documentation: The token passed by previous API calls until all requested messages are returned.

ChannelMessages.documentation: The information about, and content of, each requested message.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of moderators that you want returned.

NextToken.documentation: The token passed by previous API calls until all requested moderators are returned.

ChimeBearer.documentation: The AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call.

NextToken.documentation: The token passed by previous API calls until all requested moderators are returned.

ChannelModerators.documentation: The information about and names of each moderator.

AppInstanceUserArn.documentation: The ARN of the user in the moderated channel.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of channels in the request.

NextToken.documentation: The token returned from previous API requests until the number of channels moderated by the user is reached.

ChimeBearer.documentation: The AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call.

NextToken.documentation: The token returned from previous API requests until the number of channels moderated by the user is reached.

Privacy.documentation: The privacy setting. PUBLIC retrieves all the public channels. PRIVATE retrieves private channels. Only an AppInstanceAdmin can retrieve private channels.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of channels that you want to return.

NextToken.documentation: The token passed by previous API calls until all requested channels are returned.

ChimeBearer.documentation: The AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call.

NextToken.documentation: The token returned from previous API requests until the number of channels is reached.

Url.documentation: The endpoint to which you establish a websocket connection.

MessagingSessionEndpoint.documentation: The websocket endpoint used to connect to Amazon Chime SDK messaging.

NotFoundException.documentation: One or more of the resources in the request does not exist in the system.

ChannelArn.documentation: The ARN of the channel containing the messages that you want to redact.

MessageId.documentation: The ID of the message being redacted.

ChimeBearer.documentation: The AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call.

ChannelArn.documentation: The ARN of the channel containing the messages that you want to redact.

MessageId.documentation: The ID of the message being redacted.

Persistence.documentation: Boolean that controls whether the message is persisted on the back end. Required.

ChimeBearer.documentation: The AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call.

MessageId.documentation: The ID string assigned to each message.

Tag.documentation: Describes a tag applied to a resource.

ThrottledClientException.documentation: The client exceeded its request rate limit.

UnauthorizedClientException.documentation: The client is not currently authorized to make the request.

MessageId.documentation: The ID string of the message being updated.

Content.documentation: The content of the message being updated.

Metadata.documentation: The metadata of the message being updated.

ChimeBearer.documentation: The AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call.

MessageId.documentation: The ID string of the message being updated.

ChimeBearer.documentation: The AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call.
The AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call.

documentation: The Amazon Chime SDK Messaging APIs in this section allow software developers to send and receive messages in custom messaging applications. These APIs depend on the frameworks provided by the Amazon Chime SDK Identity APIs. For more information about the messaging APIs, see Amazon Chime SDK messaging
